comment_text.mn148:2.1: While this description of the Dhamma is frequently found, it is not elsewhere used as an introduction to a specific teaching.
comment_text.mn148:9.3: We have now included the six sense fields, contact, feeling, and craving, which are four of the items of dependent origination.
comment_text.mn148:10.1: This is an unusual use of na upapajjati in the sense, “is not tenable”, “does not obtain”, or “is not justified”.
comment_text.mn148:28.1: Literally, “With contact as dependency arises what is felt …”
comment_text.mn148:41.10: This is not found in parallel passages and is probably a later addition.

root_text.mn148:1.2: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
root_text.mn148:2.1: “dhammaṁ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsessāmi, yadidaṁ—
root_text.mn148:2.3: Taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
root_text.mn148:2.4: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
root_text.mn148:3.1: “Cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbāni, cha bāhirāni āyatanāni veditabbāni, cha viññāṇakāyā veditabbā, cha phassakāyā veditabbā, cha vedanākāyā veditabbā, cha taṇhākāyā veditabbā.
root_text.mn148:4.2: iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ. Kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
root_text.mn148:4.3: Cakkhāyatanaṁ, sotāyatanaṁ, ghānāyatanaṁ, jivhāyatanaṁ, kāyāyatanaṁ, manāyatanaṁ.
root_text.mn148:4.5: iti yaṁ taṁ vuttaṁ, idametaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ.
root_text.mn148:5.2: iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ. Kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
root_text.mn148:5.3: Rūpāyatanaṁ, saddāyatanaṁ, gandhāyatanaṁ, rasāyatanaṁ, phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ, dhammāyatanaṁ.
root_text.mn148:5.5: iti yaṁ taṁ vuttaṁ, idametaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ.
root_text.mn148:6.2: iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ. Kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
root_text.mn148:6.3: Cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṁ,
root_text.mn148:6.4: sotañca paṭicca sadde ca uppajjati sotaviññāṇaṁ,
root_text.mn148:6.5: ghānañca paṭicca gandhe ca uppajjati ghānaviññāṇaṁ,
root_text.mn148:6.6: jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhāviññāṇaṁ,
root_text.mn148:6.7: kāyañca paṭicca phoṭṭhabbe ca uppajjati kāyaviññāṇaṁ,
root_text.mn148:6.8: manañca paṭicca dhamme ca uppajjati manoviññāṇaṁ.
root_text.mn148:6.10: iti yaṁ taṁ vuttaṁ, idametaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ.
root_text.mn148:7.2: iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ. Kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
root_text.mn148:7.3: Cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso;
root_text.mn148:7.4: sotañca paṭicca sadde ca uppajjati sotaviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso;
root_text.mn148:7.5: ghānañca paṭicca gandhe ca uppajjati ghānaviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso;
root_text.mn148:7.6: jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhāviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso;
root_text.mn148:7.7: kāyañca paṭicca phoṭṭhabbe ca uppajjati kāyaviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso;
root_text.mn148:7.8: manañca paṭicca dhamme ca uppajjati manoviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso.
root_text.mn148:7.10: iti yaṁ taṁ vuttaṁ, idametaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ.
root_text.mn148:8.2: iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ. Kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
root_text.mn148:8.3: Cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā;
root_text.mn148:8.4: sotañca paṭicca sadde ca uppajjati sotaviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā;
root_text.mn148:8.5: ghānañca paṭicca gandhe ca uppajjati ghānaviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā;
root_text.mn148:8.6: jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhāviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā;
root_text.mn148:8.7: kāyañca paṭicca phoṭṭhabbe ca uppajjati kāyaviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā;
root_text.mn148:8.8: manañca paṭicca dhamme ca uppajjati manoviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā.
root_text.mn148:8.10: iti yaṁ taṁ vuttaṁ, idametaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ.
root_text.mn148:9.2: iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ. Kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
root_text.mn148:9.3: Cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā, vedanāpaccayā taṇhā;
root_text.mn148:9.4: sotañca paṭicca sadde ca uppajjati sotaviññāṇaṁ …pe…
root_text.mn148:9.5: ghānañca paṭicca gandhe ca uppajjati ghānaviññāṇaṁ …
root_text.mn148:9.6: jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhāviññāṇaṁ …
root_text.mn148:9.7: kāyañca paṭicca phoṭṭhabbe ca uppajjati kāyaviññāṇaṁ …
root_text.mn148:9.8: manañca paṭicca dhamme ca uppajjati manoviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā, vedanāpaccayā taṇhā.
root_text.mn148:9.10: iti yaṁ taṁ vuttaṁ, idametaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ.
root_text.mn148:10.1: ‘Cakkhu attā’ti yo vadeyya taṁ na upapajjati.
root_text.mn148:10.3: Yassa kho pana uppādopi vayopi paññāyati, ‘attā me uppajjati ca veti cā’ti iccassa evamāgataṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:10.7: ‘Rūpā attā’ti yo vadeyya taṁ na upapajjati.
root_text.mn148:10.9: Yassa kho pana uppādopi vayopi paññāyati, ‘attā me uppajjati ca veti cā’ti iccassa evamāgataṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:10.13: ‘Cakkhuviññāṇaṁ attā’ti yo vadeyya taṁ na upapajjati.
root_text.mn148:10.15: Yassa kho pana uppādopi vayopi paññāyati, ‘attā me uppajjati ca veti cā’ti iccassa evamāgataṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:10.18: Iti cakkhu anattā, rūpā anattā, cakkhuviññāṇaṁ anattā.
root_text.mn148:10.19: ‘Cakkhusamphasso attā’ti yo vadeyya taṁ na upapajjati.
root_text.mn148:10.21: Yassa kho pana uppādopi vayopi paññāyati, ‘attā me uppajjati ca veti cā’ti iccassa evamāgataṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:10.24: Iti cakkhu anattā, rūpā anattā, cakkhuviññāṇaṁ anattā, cakkhusamphasso anattā.
root_text.mn148:10.25: ‘Vedanā attā’ti yo vadeyya taṁ na upapajjati.
root_text.mn148:10.27: Yassa kho pana uppādopi vayopi paññāyati, ‘attā me uppajjati ca veti cā’ti iccassa evamāgataṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:10.30: Iti cakkhu anattā, rūpā anattā, cakkhuviññāṇaṁ anattā, cakkhusamphasso anattā, vedanā anattā.
root_text.mn148:10.31: ‘Taṇhā attā’ti yo vadeyya taṁ na upapajjati.
root_text.mn148:10.33: Yassa kho pana uppādopi vayopi paññāyati, ‘attā me uppajjati ca veti cā’ti iccassa evamāgataṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:10.36: Iti cakkhu anattā, rūpā anattā, cakkhuviññāṇaṁ anattā, cakkhusamphasso anattā, vedanā anattā, taṇhā anattā.
root_text.mn148:11.5: ‘mano attā’ti yo vadeyya taṁ na upapajjati.
root_text.mn148:11.7: Yassa kho pana uppādopi vayopi paññāyati, ‘attā me uppajjati ca veti cā’ti iccassa evamāgataṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:12.1: ‘Dhammā attā’ti yo vadeyya taṁ na upapajjati.
root_text.mn148:12.3: Yassa kho pana uppādopi vayopi paññāyati, ‘attā me uppajjati ca veti cā’ti iccassa evamāgataṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:13.1: ‘Manoviññāṇaṁ attā’ti yo vadeyya taṁ na upapajjati.
root_text.mn148:13.3: Yassa kho pana uppādopi vayopi paññāyati, ‘attā me uppajjati ca veti cā’ti iccassa evamāgataṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:13.6: Iti mano anattā, dhammā anattā, manoviññāṇaṁ anattā.
root_text.mn148:14.1: ‘Manosamphasso attā’ti yo vadeyya taṁ na upapajjati.
root_text.mn148:14.3: Yassa kho pana uppādopi vayopi paññāyati, ‘attā me uppajjati ca veti cā’ti iccassa evamāgataṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:14.6: Iti mano anattā, dhammā anattā, manoviññāṇaṁ anattā, manosamphasso anattā.
root_text.mn148:15.1: ‘Vedanā attā’ti yo vadeyya taṁ na upapajjati.
root_text.mn148:15.3: Yassa kho pana uppādopi vayopi paññāyati, ‘attā me uppajjati ca veti cā’ti iccassa evamāgataṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:15.6: Iti mano anattā, dhammā anattā, manoviññāṇaṁ anattā, manosamphasso anattā, vedanā anattā.
root_text.mn148:15.7: ‘Taṇhā attā’ti yo vadeyya taṁ na upapajjati.
root_text.mn148:15.9: Yassa kho pana uppādopi vayopi paññāyati, ‘attā me uppajjati ca veti cā’ti iccassa evamāgataṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:15.12: Iti mano anattā, dhammā anattā, manoviññāṇaṁ anattā, manosamphasso anattā, vedanā anattā, taṇhā anattā.
root_text.mn148:16.1: Ayaṁ kho pana, bhikkhave, sakkāyasamudayagāminī paṭipadā—
root_text.mn148:16.2: cakkhuṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati;
root_text.mn148:17-21.1: rūpe ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati;
root_text.mn148:17-21.2: cakkhuviññāṇaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati;
root_text.mn148:17-21.3: cakkhusamphassaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati;
root_text.mn148:17-21.4: vedanaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati;
root_text.mn148:17-21.5: taṇhaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati;
root_text.mn148:17-21.6: sotaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati …pe…
root_text.mn148:17-21.7: ghānaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati …pe…
root_text.mn148:17-21.8: jivhaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati …pe…
root_text.mn148:17-21.9: kāyaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati …pe…
root_text.mn148:17-21.10: manaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati, dhamme ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati, manoviññāṇaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati, manosamphassaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati, vedanaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati, taṇhaṁ ‘etaṁ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:22.1: Ayaṁ kho pana, bhikkhave, sakkāyanirodhagāminī paṭipadā—
root_text.mn148:22.2: cakkhuṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:23-27.1: Rūpe ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:23-27.2: Cakkhuviññāṇaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:23-27.3: Cakkhusamphassaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:23-27.4: Vedanaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:23-27.5: Taṇhaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:23-27.6: Sotaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati …pe…
root_text.mn148:23-27.7: ghānaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati …pe…
root_text.mn148:23-27.8: jivhaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati …pe…
root_text.mn148:23-27.9: kāyaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati …pe…
root_text.mn148:23-27.10: manaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:23-27.11: Dhamme ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:23-27.12: Manoviññāṇaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:23-27.13: Manosamphassaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:23-27.14: Vedanaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:23-27.15: Taṇhaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
root_text.mn148:28.1: Cakkhuñca, bhikkhave, paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā.
root_text.mn148:28.2: So sukhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
root_text.mn148:28.4: Dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṁ kandati sammohaṁ āpajjati.
root_text.mn148:28.6: Adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno tassā vedanāya samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti.
root_text.mn148:28.8: So vata, bhikkhave, sukhāya vedanāya rāgānusayaṁ appahāya dukkhāya vedanāya paṭighānusayaṁ appaṭivinodetvā adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya avijjānusayaṁ asamūhanitvā avijjaṁ appahāya vijjaṁ anuppādetvā diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhassantakaro bhavissatīti—netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
root_text.mn148:29-33.1: Sotañca, bhikkhave, paṭicca sadde ca uppajjati sotaviññāṇaṁ …pe…
root_text.mn148:29-33.2: ghānañca, bhikkhave, paṭicca gandhe ca uppajjati ghānaviññāṇaṁ …pe…
root_text.mn148:29-33.3: jivhañca, bhikkhave, paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhāviññāṇaṁ …pe…
root_text.mn148:29-33.4: kāyañca, bhikkhave, paṭicca phoṭṭhabbe ca uppajjati kāyaviññāṇaṁ …pe…
root_text.mn148:29-33.5: manañca, bhikkhave, paṭicca dhamme ca uppajjati manoviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā.
root_text.mn148:29-33.6: So sukhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
root_text.mn148:29-33.8: Dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṁ kandati sammohaṁ āpajjati.
root_text.mn148:29-33.10: Adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno tassā vedanāya samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti.
root_text.mn148:29-33.12: So vata, bhikkhave, sukhāya vedanāya rāgānusayaṁ appahāya dukkhāya vedanāya paṭighānusayaṁ appaṭivinodetvā adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya avijjānusayaṁ asamūhanitvā avijjaṁ appahāya vijjaṁ anuppādetvā diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhassantakaro bhavissatīti—netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
root_text.mn148:34.1: Cakkhuñca, bhikkhave, paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā.
root_text.mn148:34.2: So sukhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
root_text.mn148:34.4: Dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno na socati na kilamati na paridevati na urattāḷiṁ kandati na sammohaṁ āpajjati.
root_text.mn148:34.6: Adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno tassā vedanāya samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
root_text.mn148:34.8: So vata, bhikkhave, sukhāya vedanāya rāgānusayaṁ pahāya dukkhāya vedanāya paṭighānusayaṁ paṭivinodetvā adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya avijjānusayaṁ samūhanitvā avijjaṁ pahāya vijjaṁ uppādetvā diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhassantakaro bhavissatīti—ṭhānametaṁ vijjati.
root_text.mn148:35.1: Sotañca, bhikkhave, paṭicca sadde ca uppajjati sotaviññāṇaṁ …pe….
root_text.mn148:36.1: Ghānañca, bhikkhave, paṭicca gandhe ca uppajjati ghānaviññāṇaṁ …pe….
root_text.mn148:37.1: Jivhañca, bhikkhave, paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhāviññāṇaṁ …pe….
root_text.mn148:38.1: Kāyañca, bhikkhave, paṭicca phoṭṭhabbe ca uppajjati kāyaviññāṇaṁ …pe….
root_text.mn148:39.1: “Manañca, bhikkhave, paṭicca dhamme ca uppajjati manoviññāṇaṁ tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā.
root_text.mn148:39.2: So sukhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
root_text.mn148:39.4: Dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno na socati na kilamati na paridevati na urattāḷiṁ kandati na sammohaṁ āpajjati.
root_text.mn148:39.6: Adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno tassā vedanāya samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
root_text.mn148:39.8: So vata, bhikkhave, sukhāya vedanāya rāgānusayaṁ pahāya dukkhāya vedanāya paṭighānusayaṁ paṭivinodetvā adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya avijjānusayaṁ samūhanitvā avijjaṁ pahāya vijjaṁ uppādetvā diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhassantakaro bhavissatīti—ṭhānametaṁ vijjati.
root_text.mn148:40.1: Evaṁ passaṁ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmiṁ nibbindati, rūpesu nibbindati, cakkhuviññāṇe nibbindati, cakkhusamphasse nibbindati, vedanāya nibbindati, taṇhāya nibbindati.
root_text.mn148:41.5: manasmiṁ nibbindati, dhammesu nibbindati, manoviññāṇe nibbindati, manosamphasse nibbindati, vedanāya nibbindati, taṇhāya nibbindati.
root_text.mn148:41.6: Nibbindaṁ virajjati, virāgā vimuccati. Vimuttasmiṁ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṁ hoti.
root_text.mn148:41.7: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti pajānātī”ti.
root_text.mn148:41.9: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.
root_text.mn148:41.10: Imasmiṁ kho pana veyyākaraṇasmiṁ bhaññamāne saṭṭhimattānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṁsūti.

translation_text.mn148:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
translation_text.mn148:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
translation_text.mn148:2.1: “Mendicants, I shall teach you the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And I shall reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure, namely,
translation_text.mn148:2.3: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”
translation_text.mn148:3.1: “The six interior sense fields should be understood. The six exterior sense fields should be understood. The six classes of consciousness should be understood. The six classes of contact should be understood. The six classes of feeling should be understood. The six classes of craving should be understood.
translation_text.mn148:4.1: ‘The six interior sense fields should be understood.’
translation_text.mn148:4.2: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
translation_text.mn148:4.3: There are the sense fields of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
translation_text.mn148:4.4: ‘The six interior sense fields should be understood.’
translation_text.mn148:4.5: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.
translation_text.mn148:4.6: This is the first set of six.
translation_text.mn148:5.1: ‘The six exterior sense fields should be understood.’
translation_text.mn148:5.2: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
translation_text.mn148:5.3: There are the sense fields of sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas.
translation_text.mn148:5.4: ‘The six exterior sense fields should be understood.’
translation_text.mn148:5.5: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.
translation_text.mn148:5.6: This is the second set of six.
translation_text.mn148:6.1: ‘The six classes of consciousness should be understood.’
translation_text.mn148:6.2: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
translation_text.mn148:6.3: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights.
translation_text.mn148:6.4: Ear consciousness arises dependent on the ear and sounds.
translation_text.mn148:6.5: Nose consciousness arises dependent on the nose and smells.
translation_text.mn148:6.6: Tongue consciousness arises dependent on the tongue and tastes.
translation_text.mn148:6.7: Body consciousness arises dependent on the body and touches.
translation_text.mn148:6.8: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and ideas.
translation_text.mn148:6.9: ‘The six classes of consciousness should be understood.’
translation_text.mn148:6.10: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.
translation_text.mn148:6.11: This is the third set of six.
translation_text.mn148:7.1: ‘The six classes of contact should be understood.’
translation_text.mn148:7.2: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
translation_text.mn148:7.3: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact.
translation_text.mn148:7.4: Ear consciousness arises dependent on the ear and sounds. The meeting of the three is contact.
translation_text.mn148:7.5: Nose consciousness arises dependent on the nose and smells. The meeting of the three is contact.
translation_text.mn148:7.6: Tongue consciousness arises dependent on the tongue and tastes. The meeting of the three is contact.
translation_text.mn148:7.7: Body consciousness arises dependent on the body and touches. The meeting of the three is contact.
translation_text.mn148:7.8: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and ideas. The meeting of the three is contact.
translation_text.mn148:7.9: ‘The six classes of contact should be understood.’
translation_text.mn148:7.10: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.
translation_text.mn148:7.11: This is the fourth set of six.
translation_text.mn148:8.1: ‘The six classes of feeling should be understood.’
translation_text.mn148:8.2: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
translation_text.mn148:8.3: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a requirement for feeling.
translation_text.mn148:8.4: Ear consciousness arises dependent on the ear and sounds. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a requirement for feeling.
translation_text.mn148:8.5: Nose consciousness arises dependent on the nose and smells. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a requirement for feeling.
translation_text.mn148:8.6: Tongue consciousness arises dependent on the tongue and tastes. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a requirement for feeling.
translation_text.mn148:8.7: Body consciousness arises dependent on the body and touches. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a requirement for feeling.
translation_text.mn148:8.8: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and ideas. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a requirement for feeling.
translation_text.mn148:8.9: ‘The six classes of feeling should be understood.’
translation_text.mn148:8.10: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.
translation_text.mn148:8.11: This is the fifth set of six.
translation_text.mn148:9.1: ‘The six classes of craving should be understood.’
translation_text.mn148:9.2: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
translation_text.mn148:9.3: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a requirement for feeling. Feeling is a requirement for craving.
translation_text.mn148:9.8: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and ideas. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a requirement for feeling. Feeling is a requirement for craving.
translation_text.mn148:9.9: ‘The six classes of craving should be understood.’
translation_text.mn148:9.10: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.
translation_text.mn148:9.11: This is the sixth set of six.
translation_text.mn148:10.1: If anyone says, ‘the eye is self,’ that is not tenable.
translation_text.mn148:10.2: The arising and vanishing of the eye is evident,
translation_text.mn148:10.3: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
translation_text.mn148:10.4: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
translation_text.mn148:10.6: So the eye is not self.
translation_text.mn148:10.7: If anyone says, ‘sights are self,’ that is not tenable.
translation_text.mn148:10.8: The arising and vanishing of sights is evident,
translation_text.mn148:10.9: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
translation_text.mn148:10.10: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
translation_text.mn148:10.12: So the eye is not self and sights are not self.
translation_text.mn148:10.13: If anyone says, ‘eye consciousness is self,’ that is not tenable.
translation_text.mn148:10.14: The arising and vanishing of eye consciousness is evident,
translation_text.mn148:10.15: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
translation_text.mn148:10.16: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
translation_text.mn148:10.18: So the eye, sights, and eye consciousness are not self.
translation_text.mn148:10.19: If anyone says, ‘eye contact is self,’ that is not tenable.
translation_text.mn148:10.20: The arising and vanishing of eye contact is evident,
translation_text.mn148:10.21: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
translation_text.mn148:10.22: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
translation_text.mn148:10.24: So the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact are not self.
translation_text.mn148:10.25: If anyone says, ‘feeling is self,’ that is not tenable.
translation_text.mn148:10.26: The arising and vanishing of feeling is evident,
translation_text.mn148:10.27: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
translation_text.mn148:10.28: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
translation_text.mn148:10.30: So the eye, sights, eye consciousness, eye contact, and feeling are not self.
translation_text.mn148:10.31: If anyone says, ‘craving is self,’ that is not tenable.
translation_text.mn148:10.32: The arising and vanishing of craving is evident,
translation_text.mn148:10.33: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
translation_text.mn148:10.34: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
translation_text.mn148:10.36: So the eye, sights, eye consciousness, eye contact, feeling, and craving are not self.
translation_text.mn148:11.1: If anyone says, ‘the ear is self’ …
translation_text.mn148:11.5: ‘the mind is self,’ that is not tenable.
translation_text.mn148:11.6: The arising and vanishing of the mind is evident,
translation_text.mn148:11.7: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
translation_text.mn148:11.8: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
translation_text.mn148:11.10: So the mind is not self.
translation_text.mn148:15.7: ‘craving is self,’ that is not tenable.
translation_text.mn148:15.8: The arising and vanishing of craving is evident,
translation_text.mn148:15.9: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
translation_text.mn148:15.10: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
translation_text.mn148:15.12: So the mind, ideas, mind consciousness, mind contact, feeling, and craving are not self.
translation_text.mn148:16.1: Now, mendicants, this is the way that leads to the origin of substantial reality.
translation_text.mn148:16.2: You regard the eye like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’
translation_text.mn148:17-21.5: craving like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’
translation_text.mn148:17-21.10: mind … ideas … mind consciousness … mind contact … feeling … craving like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’
translation_text.mn148:22.1: But this is the way that leads to the cessation of substantial reality.
translation_text.mn148:22.2: You regard the eye like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
translation_text.mn148:23-27.5: craving like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
translation_text.mn148:23-27.10: mind like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
translation_text.mn148:23-27.15: craving like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
translation_text.mn148:28.1: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a requirement for the arising of what is felt as pleasant, painful, or neutral.
translation_text.mn148:28.2: When you experience a pleasant feeling, if you approve, welcome, and keep clinging to it,
translation_text.mn148:28.3: the underlying tendency to greed underlies that.
translation_text.mn148:28.4: When you experience a painful feeling, if you sorrow and wail and lament, beating your breast and falling into confusion,
translation_text.mn148:28.5: the underlying tendency to repulsion underlies that.
translation_text.mn148:28.6: When you experience a neutral feeling, if you don’t truly understand that feeling’s origin, disappearance, gratification, drawback, and escape,
translation_text.mn148:28.7: the underlying tendency to ignorance underlies that.
translation_text.mn148:28.8: Mendicants, without giving up the underlying tendency to greed for pleasant feeling, without dispelling the underlying tendency to repulsion towards painful feeling, without eradicating ignorance in the case of neutral feeling, without giving up ignorance and without giving rise to knowledge, it is quite impossible to make an end of suffering in this very life.
translation_text.mn148:29-33.5: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and ideas. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a requirement for the arising of what is felt as pleasant, painful, or neutral.
translation_text.mn148:29-33.6: When you experience a pleasant feeling, if you approve, welcome, and keep clinging to it,
translation_text.mn148:29-33.7: the underlying tendency to greed underlies that.
translation_text.mn148:29-33.8: When you experience a painful feeling, if you sorrow and wail and lament, beating your breast and falling into confusion,
translation_text.mn148:29-33.9: the underlying tendency to repulsion underlies that.
translation_text.mn148:29-33.10: When you experience a neutral feeling, if you don’t truly understand that feeling’s origin, disappearance, gratification, drawback, and escape,
translation_text.mn148:29-33.11: the underlying tendency to ignorance underlies that.
translation_text.mn148:29-33.12: Mendicants, without giving up the underlying tendency to greed for pleasant feeling, without dispelling the underlying tendency to repulsion towards painful feeling, without eradicating ignorance in the case of neutral feeling, without giving up ignorance and without giving rise to knowledge, it is quite impossible to make an end of suffering in this very life.
translation_text.mn148:34.1: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a requirement for the arising of what is felt as pleasant, painful, or neutral.
translation_text.mn148:34.2: When you experience a pleasant feeling, if you don’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to it,
translation_text.mn148:34.3: the underlying tendency to greed does not underlie that.
translation_text.mn148:34.4: When you experience a painful feeling, if you don’t sorrow or wail or lament, beating your breast and falling into confusion,
translation_text.mn148:34.5: the underlying tendency to repulsion does not underlie that.
translation_text.mn148:34.6: When you experience a neutral feeling, if you truly understand that feeling’s origin, disappearance, gratification, drawback, and escape,
translation_text.mn148:34.7: the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie that.
translation_text.mn148:34.8: Mendicants, after giving up the underlying tendency to greed for pleasant feeling, after dispelling the underlying tendency to repulsion towards painful feeling, after eradicating ignorance in the case of neutral feeling, after giving up ignorance and giving rise to knowledge, it’s quite possible to make an end of suffering in this very life.
translation_text.mn148:39.1: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and ideas. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a requirement for what is felt as pleasant, painful, or neutral.
translation_text.mn148:39.2: When you experience a pleasant feeling, if you don’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to it,
translation_text.mn148:39.3: the underlying tendency to greed does not underlie that.
translation_text.mn148:39.4: When you experience a painful feeling, if you don’t sorrow or wail or lament, beating your breast and falling into confusion,
translation_text.mn148:39.5: the underlying tendency to repulsion does not underlie that.
translation_text.mn148:39.6: When you experience a neutral feeling, if you truly understand that feeling’s origin, disappearance, gratification, drawback, and escape,
translation_text.mn148:39.7: the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie that.
translation_text.mn148:39.8: Mendicants, after giving up the underlying tendency to greed for pleasant feeling, after dispelling the underlying tendency to repulsion towards painful feeling, after eradicating ignorance in the case of neutral feeling, after giving up ignorance and giving rise to knowledge, it’s quite possible to make an end of suffering in this very life.
translation_text.mn148:40.1: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, sights, eye consciousness, eye contact, feeling, and craving.
translation_text.mn148:41.1: They grow disillusioned with the ear …
translation_text.mn148:41.5: mind, ideas, mind consciousness, mind contact, feeling, and craving.
translation_text.mn148:41.6: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When it is freed, they know it is freed.
translation_text.mn148:41.7: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’”
translation_text.mn148:41.8: That is what the Buddha said.
translation_text.mn148:41.9: Satisfied, the mendicants approved what the Buddha said.
translation_text.mn148:41.10: And while this discourse was being spoken, the minds of sixty mendicants were freed from defilements by not grasping.
